title: Unified View of Nondeterminism - THE SIXTH BREAKTHROUGH
main_results: Nondeterminism = Guessing Power (orthogonal to nesting depth)
significance: SIXTH BREAKTHROUGH - Nondeterminism unified across all models
key_insights: Nondeterminism provides guessing power ORTHOGONAL to nesting depth
Two dimensions of complexity: DEPTH (nesting) and MODE (det/nondet)
NTIME hierarchy is strict and parallels TIME hierarchy
Guessing compresses search space from explicit to implicit
L < NL proves guessing helps at log scale; P vs NP asks about poly scale

theorems.cc_ntime_equivalence: CC-NTIME[t] = NTIME[t] for all t >= log n
theorems.ntime_hierarchy: NTIME(t) < NTIME(t * log t) for all t >= log n
theorems.unified_principle: Nondeterminism = guessing power, orthogonal to nesting depth

two_dimensions.depth: How many levels of nesting? (NC^k, TIME(log^k n), etc.)

connection_to_p_vs_np: P vs NP asks whether guessing helps at polynomial scale. L < NL proves guessing helps at log scale. Our framework clarifies the question but doesn't yet answer it.
six_breakthroughs: Phase 61: L != NL (nondeterminism helps in log space)
Phase 66: Nondeterminism unified (nesting depth + guessing power)
